About Me

Who am I?

Hi! My name is Jillian and I’m from 📍Frisco, TX (near Dallas). I study Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (EECS) + Business Administration in the Management, Entrepreneurship, and Technology (M.E.T.) program at UC Berkeley. I’m passionate about data science and machine learning, especially using the power of data to answer real world questions, enhance personalized consumer experiences, and improve people’s daily lives.

Learn more about my 📊projects, read my ✍️blog, or take a peek at my 📚course notes.

What do I do?

On campus, I’m a project leader, account manager, and senior advisor for Voyager Consulting, and I teach UC Berkeley’s CS 61A as an Academic Intern and through Computer Science Mentors. I play on the Cal Women’s Club Volleyball team and I’m a mentor in the Engineering Berkeley Mentorship Cohort.

Previously, I led DEI initiatives in the Society of Women Engineers and was involved in Girls Who Code. I developed a passion for teaching when growing Gold Tutoring since 2017, and gave college apps advice through YouTube videos and Gold College Essays.

Click here to read more about my experiences!

What are my goals?

In short? To make a real impact on the world.
More specifically, I’d like to lean into my lifelong commitment to propel:

👩🏻‍💻women in STEM and youth empowerment
📈the power of consumer-centric data
♻️social transformation and environmental progress

In the meantime, I’m doing my best to learn as much as I can about the things I care about. :)
